poem:
**Surprise Growth**  

In the quiet chatter of numbers,  
February whispered a secret—  
a half-percent rise,  
like a crocus breaking frost.  

Rachel Reeves smiled quietly,  
while elsewhere,  
tariffs brewed storms,  
dancing on the edges  
of an unforeseen spring.  

Economists regrouped,  
their neat graphs,  
now wild with possibilities.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK economy far exceeds forecasts to grow 0.5% in boost to Rachel Reeves The UK economy unexpectedly expanded by 0.5% in February, figures show, in a boost for Rachel Reeves before an expected downturn triggered by Donald Trump’s tariff war. The increase in gross domestic product in February was five times larger than the 0.1% that a poll of City economists had forecast, while January’s figure of a modest fall of 0.1% was revised up". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
